key_title: Key to the varieties of Vittadinia dissecta

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Vittadinia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Vittadinia. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Hairs of leaves and stems subappressed, to 1 mm long; ultimate divisions of leaves 1.5–4 mm wide, obtuse; involucral bracts with few hairs (and these mostly in the upper part) or hairs lacking; cypselas 3.5–4.5 mm long; apparently Gippsland only

Hairs of leaves and stems spreading, to 2 mm long or more; ultimate divisions of leaves to c. 2 mm wide, obtuse or acute; involucral bracts with hairs evenly scattered over surface or along midrib; cypselas 3.5–5.5 mm long; north-western
